:py:mod:`pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.calcintlength`
================================================

.. py:module:: pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.calcintlength

.. autoapi-nested-parse::

   Provides high-performance integer and double length calculation utilities, matching Fortran's intlength module, using NumPy, Numba, and NumericTypes.

   This module is optimized for scientific computing and high-performance clusters, supporting batch operations on large arrays.

   Author: Rahul R. Sah



Module Contents
---------------

Classes
~~~~~~~

.. autoapisummary::

   pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.calcintlength.IntLengthCalculator




.. py:class:: IntLengthCalculator


   Calculator for determining the string length of integer and floating-point numbers, similar to Fortran's intlength module.
   Uses NumPy, Numba, and NumericTypes for performance and precision.

   .. method:: CalcIntLength(i: Union[int, np.ndarray]) -> Union[int, np.ndarray]

      Calculates the number of characters needed to represent an integer or array of integers.

   .. method:: CalcDblLength(x: Union[float, np.ndarray], p: int, e: int, frmt: str) -> Union[int, np.ndarray]

      Calculates the number of characters needed to represent a float or array of floats in a given format.

   .. method:: BatchContext():

      Context manager for efficient batch operations on large datasets.


   .. py:class:: BatchContext


      Bases: :py:obj:`ContextManager`

      Context manager for efficient batch operations on large datasets.
      Use this context to ensure memory locality and optimal performance on HPC clusters.

      .. rubric:: Examples

      >>> with IntLengthCalculator.BatchContext():
      ...     result = IntLengthCalculator.CalcIntLength(np.arange(-1000000, 1000000))
      ...

      .. py:method:: __enter__() -> IntLengthCalculator

         Return `self` upon entering the runtime context.


      .. py:method:: __exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb) -> Optional[bool]

         Raise any exception triggered within the runtime context.



   .. py:method:: calcIntLength(i: Union[int, numpy.ndarray]) -> Union[int, numpy.ndarray]
      :classmethod:

      Calculates the number of characters needed to represent an integer or array of integers, including sign if negative.

      :param i: The integer or array of integers to evaluate.
      :type i: int or np.ndarray

      :returns: The number of characters needed to represent the integer(s) as string(s).
      :rtype: int or np.ndarray


   .. py:method:: calcDblLength(x: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], p: int, e: int, frmt: str) -> Union[int, numpy.ndarray]
      :classmethod:

      Calculates the number of characters needed to represent a floating-point number or array in a given format.

      :param x: The floating-point number or array to evaluate.
      :type x: float or np.ndarray
      :param p: Precision (number of digits after decimal).
      :type p: int
      :param e: Exponent width.
      :type e: int
      :param frmt: Format specifier ("ES", "EN", "E", or "D").
      :type frmt: str

      :returns: The number of characters needed to represent the float(s) as string(s).
      :rtype: int or np.ndarray
